intro: Mavia judicia, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-shaped, evergreen leaves that form a dense rosette at the base. It produces an underground bulb that stores nutrients, allowing it to survive dry periods. Mavia judicia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
